lines.content: * Kiko is a task management chatbot that allows users to manage their tasks.
* Supports adding todos, deadlines, and events, marking tasks as done/not done,
* The chatbot continues until the user says "bye".
* Main entry point for the Kiko chatbot application.
* Displays a greeting, then enters a loop to process user commands.
* Commands are parsed and delegated to appropriate handler methods.
* The loop continues until the user enters "bye".

* Displays the greeting message when the chatbot starts.
String greeting = " Hello! I'm Kiko the bunny\n"
+ " What can I do for you? >.<";
* Displays the farewell message when the chatbot exits.

System.out.println(" Walao i dunno what that means ;<<");
* @param tasks Array of task strings to display

System.out.println(" Now you have " + remainingCount + " tasks in the list.");

* Displays an error message for invalid task number.
* @param maxTaskNumber The maximum valid task number
System.out.println(" I dunno this task number. Please enter a number between 1 and " + maxTaskNumber);
* Displays an error message for invalid number format.
* @param command The command that caused the error (mark, unmark, delete)
System.out.println(" Oi enter a valid task number after '" + command + "'");
* Displays an error message for empty todo description.
System.out.println(" Oi provide a description for the todo task");
* Displays usage instructions for deadline command.
System.out.println(" OIII use the format: deadline <description> /by <date>");
System.out.println(" Date formats accepted: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm, dd/MM/yyyy HHmm, MM/dd/yyyy HHmm");
* Displays usage instructions for deadline command when /by is missing.
System.out.println(" OIII use the format: deadline <description> /by <date>");
System.out.println(" Date formats accepted: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm, dd/MM/yyyy HHmm, MM/dd/yyyy HHmm");
* Displays an error message for missing deadline description or date.
System.out.println(" OIIIIII provide both description and deadline date");
* Displays usage instructions for event command.
System.out.println(" OIIII use the format: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
System.out.println(" Date formats accepted: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm, dd/MM/yyyy HHmm, MM/dd/yyyy HHmm");
* Displays usage instructions for event command when /from or /to is missing.
System.out.println(" OIIII use the format: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
System.out.println(" Date formats accepted: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm, dd/MM/yyyy HHmm, MM/dd/yyyy HHmm");
* Displays an error message for missing event fields.
System.out.println(" OIIII provide description, start time, and end time");
* Displays date format error messages with examples.
System.out.println(" OI! Invalid date format. Try these formats:");

* JUnit tests for the Storage class.
* Tests the parseTaskFromString method with various scenarios including edge cases.
assertTrue(task instanceof Todo, "Should be Todo instance");
assertTrue(task instanceof Todo, "Should be Todo instance");
assertTrue(task instanceof Deadline, "Should be Deadline instance");
assertTrue(task instanceof Event, "Should be Event instance");
assertEquals(expectedFrom, event.getFrom(), "Event start time should match");
assertEquals(expectedTo, event.getTo(), "Event end time should match");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for invalid format (too few parts)");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for empty line");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for null line");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for invalid task type");
String line = "D | 0 | Invalid date task | invalid-date-format";
assertNull(task, "Should return null for invalid date format");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for Deadline missing date");
assertNull(task, "Should return null for Event missing dates");
String line = "E | 0 | Event with only start | 2024-12-25 1400";
assertNull(task, "Should return null for Event with only start date");
String line = "  T  |  1  |  Task with whitespace  ";
assertEquals("Task with whitespace", task.getDescription(), "Should trim whitespace");
assertTrue(task.isDone(), "Should parse status correctly despite whitespace");
String line = "T | 0 | Task with | pipe character";
// This should parse as "Task with" since the pipe splits the description
assertNotNull(task, "Should parse task with special characters");
assertEquals("Task with", task.getDescription(), "Should handle pipe in description");
// The parsing might fail due to the trailing space after the last pipe
// Let's test with a more realistic empty description scenario
assertNull(task, "Should return null for malformed line with trailing space");
* JUnit tests for the TaskList class.
* Tests the markTask method with various scenarios including edge cases.
// Create a fresh TaskList for each test
// Clean up test file after each test
assertTrue(result, "markTask should return true for valid index");
// Verify the task is marked as done
assertTrue(task.isDone(), "Task should be marked as done");
assertFalse(result, "markTask should return false for index 0");
// Verify the task is still not done
assertFalse(task.isDone(), "Task should not be marked as done");
assertFalse(result, "markTask should return false for negative index");
// Test marking index beyond list size
assertFalse(result, "markTask should return false for index beyond list size");
// Test marking task in empty list
assertFalse(result, "markTask should return false for empty list");
assertTrue(result, "markTask should return true for valid index");
// Verify only the second task is marked
assertFalse(taskList.getTask(1).isDone(), "First task should not be marked");
assertFalse(taskList.getTask(3).isDone(), "Third task should not be marked");
assertTrue(result, "markTask should return true even if task already done");
assertTrue(taskList.getTask(1).isDone(), "Task should still be marked as done");
